primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the 'Old Age' of sin and death through the crucifixion of Jesus to liberate humanity from its entropic spiral toward destruction.

tekstueel_bewijs: God the Father and God the Son together are in charge of the entire operation
God calls forth his whole creation
God in Jesus Christ places himself squarely in the path of this world's careening course

object.identificatie: The liberation of humanity and the reversal of the 'Old Age' into the 'Age to Come'.
tekstueel_bewijs: to unlock our prison doors and lead us free
makes you and me and the whole creation new

zender.identificatie: God's Future / The Age to Come
tekstueel_bewijs: It is God's future that is decisive for the present.
invasion of 'the present evil age' by God's future.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Saints / The Hearers / The Whole Creation
tekstueel_bewijs: many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised
makes you and me and the whole creation new
Life is given to the dead through Jesus' death.
Jesus' unconditional love of us all, poured out on the Cross
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the 'directing intelligence' behind the passive verbs.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Old Age (Sin, Death, Satan, Entropy)
tekstueel_bewijs: the powers of death have done their worst
the entropic spiral of creation toward death and extinction
the Old Age of sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but a 'world-age' and a 'downward spiral' that humanity cannot escape on its own.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the liberation: living in the 'new direction' of praise and service.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (in Christ)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/service) is explicitly presented as a result of the primary program (liberation/grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Cross → God → The Old Age/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God calls forth his whole creation.
God in Jesus Christ places himself squarely in the path...
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We orient ourselves not to what we have been...
The Corinthian Christians... loved Easter and hated Good Friday.

voorbeelden: First we should notice the verbs...
Not every one wants to look at the Crucified One.
What is the meaning of these bizarre events?
The powers of death... cannot contain him.
His death has set us free.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power-to-do' (Pouvoir) in the face of human 'Inability-to-do'. It is a theology of divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death) through ~S2 (The splitting of rocks/invasion) to S1 (New Creation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'unlooked-for invasion' which halts the spiral of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a cosmic axis and a prison.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor, the problem is cosmic rather than merely moral, and the solution is an unconditional divine act.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God the Father and God the Son together are in charge of the entire operation.
Jesus' unconditional love... has changed everything.

bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Jesus is specifically NOT an example here)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus Christ did not enter death in order to give us an example... but rather, to unlock our prison doors.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the 'prison' of self-performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God provides the competence the human lacks.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly ordered: God's cosmic act (Primary) enables the hearer's new life (Secondary).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The invasion of the Old Age by the New; the unlocking of prison doors; the defeat of the powers of death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' to God/Jesus directly, with the Spirit being the implied 'directing intelligence'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as an 'entropic spiral' and 'self-destruction'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a rigorous theocentric structure where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance for a Good Friday context.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Devoir' (Must) trap.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Old Age) is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It systematically dismantles human agency as the source of salvation and replaces it with the 'mighty arm' of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'triple passive' as a stylistic device, Greimasian analysis reveals these passives as 'Divine Passives' where God is the hidden Actantial Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek; semiotics explains how the 'invasion' metaphor functions as the engine of the sermon's logic.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—moving from the human 'downward spiral' to God's 'invasion'.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a perfect example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
